name: Gardner
message: I've gotten completely relaxed, but it's about time we really got down to business.

name: Thomas
message: Are we still going somewhere?
I'm already worn out, so I'll just wait for you at the pub with a drink.

name: Jonathan
message: What are you saying, like a kid?
First of all, there's no way I can leave the store unattended with a dangerous guy like you left alone.

name: Thomas
message: That's a harsh thing to say.

name: Cordelia
message: Sorry to keep you waiting.
Shall we get going soon?

name: Thomas
message: Are you really going？
Honestly, I think just having some drinks here would be a hell of a lot more worthwhile.

name: Thomas
message: Hey, what's going on?
Drinking again？

name: Cordelia
message: どうしたの、こんなところに来て。
If you're planning to have a drink, I'll open up the shop...

name: Jonathan
message: いや、まだやらなければならない事もあるし‥‥‥

name: Thomas
message: Then why'd you come to a place like this？
You shouldn't push yourself too hard.

name: Cordelia
message: You don't have to worry about me.
I haven't prepared anything, so I can't serve any food.
Before the villagers forget about Gilman House, let's have Cordelia open up the shop.
There's still nobody around on the lonely back street.
All the more so since Gilman House, the only lively spot around here, is closed for business.
村人から苦情が出る前にコーデリアに店を開業させないと、ただでさえ敵意に満ちた村人が、さらに我々を目の敵にすることは明白だ。
Probably didn't have the luxury for that, but the outside of the shop hasn't had any repairs done in ages.
If you still plan to keep the business running for a while, shouldn't you arrange repairs as soon as possible?
The only inheritance Cordelia’s foster parents left her is the Gilman House.
Right now, the shop is closed, so there aren't any customers around.
It's not all that impressive, but I wonder if it's a pretty heavy load for Cordelia's slender arms to hold up.
The shop's name is written in plain Gothic letters.
Judging by the way the paint is peeling from rust, it looks like it's been left alone for over ten years.
The shop's name is written in spelling that can't really be called good.
I wonder where the name 'Gilman House' comes from？
Come to think of it, I've never heard it, but I wonder what Cordelia's last name is.

name: Cordelia
message: You don’t have to make such a pouty face, I’ll open it for you.
At a glance, you can’t tell if it’s open or not.
The villagers who came hoping to get some cheap liquor from midday must have been pretty disappointed when they noticed the door was locked.

name: Cordelia
message: Are you planning to just stand here and talk forever？
If you drop by the shop, I'll treat you to at least a drink.

name: Jonathan
message: Are you closed right now？
This is probably the only place in the village where you can get booze, so it feels like the villagers are gonna end up hating us.

name: Cordelia
message: It can't be helped.
I'm the only employee, after all.

name: Jonathan
message: If that's the case, why not just hire someone temporarily?

name: Cordelia
message: この村で気軽に店を任せられる人なんていないわ。
I　don't　want　people　handing　out　free　drinks　or　skimming　cash　from　the　register　without　my　permission.

name: Jonathan
message: I guess it's better than having the shop door busted up by some drunk wanting booze.

name: Cordelia
message: No one would go out of their way to do something that much of a hassle. If you're gonna do all that, you'd probably just flop down on the street somewhere and wait for me to come back.
Plaza
Fish Scale Inn
General store
Ruins
Archives
Church　of　Dagon
Harbor
Go inside

Go inside
